text: Hi all! Wanted to provide a quick Child Theme update before we break for our <https://www.HubSpot.com/company-news/HubSpot-unplugged|global week of rest>. Child Themes in the design manager has been rolled out to all new portals created in the last few months and 50% of remaining portals. If you would like to add the new child themes feature to a portal that it has not yet been added to, please let me know by Friday. Thanks!

I am actually referencing properly the theme fields, for some reason even if I try to remove all the CSS to see if it does something at least, it appears to not change at all in the website. And in the page it seems to include this stylesheet so I don't know why would that happen.

I understand that it is borrowing the stylesheet of the other theme because there are modules in the page referencing to that specific stylesheet... But the real issue is that the stylesheet is not rendering properly on the final page even though it looks ok on the content editor preview

I can force the stylesheet of the cloned theme to take priority by not using the `require_css` function and instead use a `<link>` tag directly and put it after the `standard_header_includes` but I will still have the rendering issues
